title: Practical Counting: Money, Time, Age
objectives: Tell time and age with correct systems
context: Korean swaps between Sino and native numbers depending on what you're counting.
Money, dates, minutes use Sino numbers; hours and age use native (with some exceptions).
Practice mixing both systems in one sentence for real-life fluency.

sentences.english: The room is on the 7th floor.

explanation: 가격/돈 use Sino numbers + 원: 삼만 칠천 원 (37,000 won). Asking price: 얼마예요?
Clock time mixes systems: hours = native (한 시, 두 시), minutes = Sino (십 분, 이십오 분).
Age uses native numbers with 살: 스물다섯 살 (25). In very formal settings, Sino with 세 sometimes appears, but 살 covers most cases.
층 uses Sino: 1층 (il cheung), 7층 (chil cheung). 번 marks order/number: 몇 번 버스예요? (Which bus number is it?).
Duration 'for X hours/minutes' uses -동안 or just counters: 두 시간 동안 공부했어요 (studied for two hours), 10분만 기다려 주세요 (please wait only 10 minutes).
